page.title: 13PRINCESS MARINA HOUSE.
page.content: Princess Marina House Convalescent and Residential Centre stands on the foreshore at Rustington. The Centre is owned by the R.A.F. Benevolent Fund and is open to all those now serving or who have served in the R.A.F., W.R.A.F. and Air Force Nursing Service or their dependents. Residential places are offered to those aged between 65 and 80 and who have usually served for at least ten years. The South Wing takes 46 guests for convalescent periods up to four weeks whilst the north wing provides a perm- anent home for 50 residents and has facilities for the disabled. The Centre has its own private beach sun terrace and spacious grounds . Adjacent to the south wing the Centre has its own club with a bar, games room and sun verandah.
